p: Despite the injunctions purportedly created to stop financial harm, assessments reveal that several billion dollars of taxpayer subsidies would be needed for the TMX project (with costs considerably more than double the originally quoted amount [www.wcel.org/media-release/federal-government-hiding-true-cost-trans-mountain-pipeline and https://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/british-columbia/trans-mountain-pipeline-expansion-support-cost-survey-1.5468730]), highlighting that significant financial harms would occur to the broad taxpaying public if the project is to advance.
